tweet: As you make your plans for #NYE2020, make sure you you’re ready to #celebratesafe. There is no tougher person than @repjohnlewis — a man who time and time again faced evil with grace, humility and strength.  We are a better nation because of him and his moral leadership, and have his back during this difficult time.

It's been a full first year in Congress—and together we delivered real results for Arizonans. I'm proud of the work we accomplished for Arizona's 9th District, and I'm ready to continue our work in 2020. Read more:  https://medium.com/@communications.stanton/2019-legislative-report-looking-back-at-our-first-year-98ea4fa659ca … pic.twitter.com/xX0TmyqFRI
Tonight is the first night of #Kwanzaa. As you light the candles each night and reflect—from Umoja to Imani—may your Kwanzaa be filled with blessings and joy. pic.twitter.com/cjcOP53ZJ3

From my family to yours, I wish you a very Merry Christmas. May the holiday bring you the closeness of friends and the comfort of home. I’m happy to be celebrating in Arizona. pic.twitter.com/MDL4ADLPHj

I’m proud the House voted last week to advance the new USMCA. Arizona businesses—from large corporations to medium- and small-sized firms—made clear that the USMCA will provide much-needed certainty and opportunity for growth. Read what they have to say: https://stanton.house.gov/media/press-releases/arizona-businesses-call-congress-pass-usmca …
Happy Hanukkah! I hope you enjoy this first night of the Festival of Lights with friends, family and loved ones. pic.twitter.com/jmzN4cf1pl

The final 2020 National Defense Authorization Act supports a strong national defense. And I'm proud it included two key amendments I offered to improve veterans’ quality of life. Read more ➡️ https://stanton.house.gov/media/press-releases/stanton-s-initiatives-improve-veterans-quality-life-will-become-law …

This week @SenMcSallyAZ and I introduced a bipartisan bill to accelerate the development of I-11 in Arizona. I-11 would open up a new transportation corridor in Arizona, leading to new jobs and increased trade with our partners in Mexico and Canada. https://stanton.house.gov/media/press-releases/mcsally-stanton-introduce-bill-accelerate-development-i-11 …

Those of us in border states understand the value of trading with our neighbors, and growing trade relationships with Mexico and Canada is essential to Arizona. I'm proud the House voted today to advance USMCA—a win for all Arizonans. https://stanton.house.gov/media/press-releases/stanton-house-pass-bipartisan-usmca-agreement …

Today the House will take an important vote to advance an improved North American trade policy. With #USMCA, we have a real opportunity to lift job creators. From multinational companies to mid-sized and small businesses, there’s no doubt that the new USMCA is a win for Arizona. pic.twitter.com/f3sNDQyU5k

If the Administration has its way and the entire ACA is eliminated, 20 million Americans will lose their insurance coverage, 135 million Americans with pre-existing conditions will be stripped of their protections, and costs will go up for millions more.

Today the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals declared part of the Affordable Care Act unconstitutional, a decision with serious consequences. It leaves the future of health insurance for millions of Americans in limbo, with no plan to ensure families can access the care they need.

Today we provided certainty for exporters across AZ by extending the Export-Import Bank for 7 years. Last month I spoke in support of a long-term reauthorization of #EXIM, which in the last five years has helped finance upwards of $2B in exports statewide. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7aIXAS6m0g0 …

Those funds will put a spotlight on one of our nation’s deadliest epidemics, and put us on a path towards answers and solutions. I’m grateful to the work of so many organizations and advocates—and especially the young voices who relentlessly spoke up and fought for this change.

Today the House took an important and long-overdue step to reduce gun violence. For the first time in more than 20 years, we included in our spending bill an investment in gun violence prevention research.

As the House prepares to vote this week on the United States-Mexico-Canada-Agreement, Arizona businesses are speaking up about the importance of trade with our neighboring countries. Read what they have to say about how #USMCA will impact their business.  https://stanton.house.gov/media/press-releases/arizona-businesses-call-congress-pass-usmca …

UPDATE: The deadline for Open Enrollment has been extended! You now have until December 18 at 1 a.m. AZ time to re-evaluate your current health insurance or #GetCovered for 2020. Visit  http://healthcare.gov  to enroll or update your coverage now. pic.twitter.com/bd1MvrPMxz

Last week I introduced a bill with @SenMcSallyAZ to bring more tourism and recreation dollars to our state. The Southwest Tourism Expansion Act will strengthen our relationship with Mexico and open up new economic opportunities to more Arizona businesses. https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/border-issues/2019/12/12/bill-would-expand-mexican-tourism-beyond-tucson/4404751002/ …

Last night I joined my fellow House Judiciary Committee members to begin marking up H.Res. 755, Articles of Impeachment. I have been in public life for nearly two decades, and it is not lost on me that these are the most consequential votes I will ever take. My full remarks: pic.twitter.com/il8soPFcgc

H.R. 3 allows the @HHSGov secretary to negotiate lower drug prices; extends Medicare coverage to include dental, vision, and hearing; caps Medicare out-of-pocket costs for seniors and people with disabilities; reinvests the billions of dollars saved into public health and more.

But right now, most cancer medications cost more than $100,000 each year. That’s simply too expensive—and 90% of Americans agree. We took action today to lower the costs of medications and treatment and stop drug companies from ripping off American patients.

Today the House took a bold step toward lowering the cost of prescription drugs for all Americans. Families shouldn’t be burdened with the astronomical costs of life-saving treatments when faced with cancer diagnoses—or diabetes, asthma, HIV, or multiple sclerosis diagnoses.

The bipartisan Farm Workforce Modernization Act is good for Arizona’s economy—where agribusiness contributes $23.3 billion annually. I voted YES to make it easier for Arizona farmers to meet their workforce needs and provide a path for agriculture workers to earn legal status.

We are one step closer to cementing certainty for job creators throughout Arizona by securing our nation’s market access in Mexico and Canada. As we near a vote on the USMCA, I will continue to work with Arizona’s business community to ensure they have a voice in this process.

I am encouraged that a deal on the USMCA has been reached and look forward to reviewing it in detail. Strong trade relationships with our North American allies is essential to Arizona’s economy, and the USMCA gives us an opportunity to deepen those relationships.

78 years ago today, more than 2,000 Americans gave the ultimate sacrifice for our country. Today’s Pearl Harbor Remembrance Ceremony gave Arizonans a chance to honor and remember those who perished, those who survived, and their families. Thank you to all who have served. pic.twitter.com/ggZqSJM7Cz

Nothing in our democracy is more sacred than the right to vote. The SCOTUS Shelby County v. Holder decision gutted the Voting Rights Act, disenfranchising too many eligible voters. We just passed #HR4 to #RestoreTheVote and help stop the most egregious voter suppression tactics.

There are additional proposals on the table that would eliminate SNAP for another 30,000 Arizonans. I’m cosponsoring the Protect SNAP Act because Congress must take action and send a message that this self-defeating economic policy hurts real people in our communities.

Worse yet, this new restriction will also disproportionately affect Native American and rural residents in our state. It ignores the unique economic challenges in rural communities and on Tribal lands and puts those populations at greater risk. And the Administration isn't done.

Heightened work requirements for SNAP recipients does not lower unemployment rates and does not help anyone find a job. It simply takes away a vital benefit from the most vulnerable in our community. It also strips states' rights to establish their own requirements and standards.

The Trump Administration made a decision this week that will cause hundreds of thousands of Americans to lose government food benefits--including at least 6,700 Arizonans. This is a short-sighted policy change that hurts low-income individuals and tightens the cycle of poverty.

Today is International Day of Persons with Disabilities. We must grow our situational awareness of the social, political and economic obstacles people with disabilities face each and every day, and stand by them in demanding an accessible future. #IPWD2019

Thank you to Dawn Schumann and @ibtlu104 for leading the fight at Mission Mine, to Fred Yamashita from @ArizonaAFLCIO, @937USW and all of the other unions as you pursue what is right and just for workers. pic.twitter.com/OmT46IrWlX

I stand with the striking workers fighting for fair wages and benefits for ASARCO employees in Southern Arizona. The battle they are waging is important--not just for the workers and their families, but for workers across America who deserve honest pay for honest work. pic.twitter.com/LIXslohEF0

Today is the 31st #WorldAIDSDay. In 31 years, there have been incredible advances in our understanding and treatment of HIV. But 1.7M people were newly infected in 2018. It’s on us to spread awareness and erase the stigma. Together we can end HIV and AIDS for the next generation. pic.twitter.com/2AUNFFZg5K
